name: Path T Melanoma Nasopharynx
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for mucosal melanoma tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  TNM does not include a T1 or T2 category for mucosal melanoma of head and neck sites.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor involving mucosa of the following subsites:
    Inferior wall (superior surface of soft palate)
    Lateral wall extending into Eustachian tube/middle ear
    One lateral wall
    Posterior, inferior, or lateral wall(s)
    Posterior superior wall (vault)

Tumor involving mucosa only of nasopharynx, NOS

Tumor involving mucosa only:
    Hard palate
    Nasal cavity
    Oropharynx
    Paranasal sinus
    Soft palate including uvula

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades: 
     Deep soft tissue
     Cartilage
     Bone
     Overlying skin

Involvement of deep soft tissues or musculature of any structure in T3
Involvement of any structure in T3 WITH tumor described as FIXED
Involvement of any structure in T3 WITH parapharyngeal extension
Pterygopalatine fossa  WITHOUT bone invasion

Bone excluding base of skull
Cartilage, NOS
Bone, NOS 
Hypopharynx
Overlying skin
Soft tissues of neck

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Brain
    Dura
    Skull base
    Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
    Masticator space
    Carotid artery
    Prevertebral space
    Mediastinal structures

Skull base including floor of orbit
